alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 11 at 6:17PM PST until February 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT ABOVE 4500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 10 to 17 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will occur primarily along the Cascade passes, including Santiam Pass.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades
